awd_titl_txt: Materials Characterization and Bone Growth Conduction of    Calcium Phosphate Linings on Porous Titanium
awd_abstract_narration: This is a basic investigation into the mechanisms by                            which a coating of calcium phosphate ceramics enhances                          bone tissue ingrowth.  Four clearly stated hypotheses                           will be tested using in vitro preparations to examine                           bioactivity of these materials.  Resolution of the                              hypotheses should substantially improve capability to                           design surfaces for bone prostheses without requiring the                       use of bone cement.  Since breaking down of the cement is                       the primary failure mechanism of current implants, the                          work has great potential significance.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: TRUSTEES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF PENNSYLVANIA, THE
